intro: Diplostephium abietinum, commonly known as the mountain snowbell, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in a fine pubescence. The flowers, which are white or pale blue, bloom in clusters and are adapted to attract pollinators in its harsh habitat.
